cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall and meander near the coast before drifting slowly east-northeast toward the Louisiana coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O’Connor/Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island, with surge 1–3 ft extending eastward to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (up to 16%) of tropical-storm-force winds, possible gusts 40–50 mph late Monday into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of roughly 1–3 ft possible along southeast Louisiana coast, including areas near the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 7–15 inches of rain possible in southeast Louisiana, producing flash-flood risk around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; hazardous surf and rip currents
